Description: FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P22AS00623TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES.AWARD SYNOPSIS: THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT, RIVER ROAD STRUCTURES, ARE TO DEMOLISH AND REMOVE FOUR NON-HISTORIC STRUCTURES ON THE RIVER ROAD PROPERTY ON THE NEW MARKET BATTLEFIELD IN SHENANDOAH COUNTY, VIRGINIA.  THE PROJECT IS INTENDED TO RESTORE DAY OF BATTLE CONDITIONS ON THE KEY BATTLEFIELD SITE, WHICH IS PLANNED TO BE INCLUDED ON A BATTLEFIELD GREENWAY TRAIL. THE WORK IN THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT RESIDENTS, VISITORS, AND EVERYONE WHO CARES ABOUT PRESERVING AMERICAN HISTORY AND THE RURAL LANDSCAPE OF THE SHENANDOAH VALLEY.BENEFICIARIES: STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS  NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  GENERAL PUBLICSUBAWARDS: NONE

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P22AS00623TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. AWARD SYNOPSIS: THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT, HUNTSBERRY FARM FENCING, IS TO INSTALL PERIOD FENCING TO RESTORE DAY OF BATTLE CONDITIONS AND THE 19TH CENTURY FARMING LANDSCAPE ON THE HUNTSBERRY FARM PROPERTY ON THE THIRD WINCHESTER BATTLEFIELD. RECREATING THE FARM LANDSCAPE WILL HELP RESTORE THE BATTLEFIELD LANDSCAPE AND PRESERVE THE BATTLEFIELD.  IT WILL ALSO RECREATE THE SENSE OF PLACE OF THE FARM ITSELF AND HELP PRESERVE THE STORIES OF THE FREE AND ENSLAVED PERSONS WHO LIVED ON THE FARM AT THE TIME OF THE BATTLE.  BENEFICIARIES: STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS  NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS  GENERAL PUBLICSUBAWARDS: NONE

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS00623TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. AWARD SYNOPSIS  THE BRANDY STATION BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION PLAN PROJECT WILL UNDERTAKE THE CREATION OF A CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT TO IDENTIFY EXTANT HISTORIC AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESOURCES AT THE BRANDY STATION BATTLEFIELD AND PRODUCE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR HOW TO PRESERVE, REHABILITATE, AND OR RESTORE THE BATTLEFIELD LANDSCAPE.BENEFICIARIES  NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND GENERAL PUBLICSUBAWARDS  NONE

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS00623TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. AWARD SYNOPSIS  THE RESTORING A GATEWAY TO GETTYSBURG SCOPING PROJECT WILL RESEARCH AND CREATE A COMPREHENSIVE TREATMENT PLAN FOR A SECTION OF SEMINARY RIDGE AT GETTYSBURG SO THAT THE FOCUS PROPERTY CAN BE RETURNED DAY OF BATTLE CONDITIONS, WHILE INTEGRATING CONSIDERATIONS FOR IMPACT ON HISTORIC RESOURCES, ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS, PEDESTRIAN SAFETY, ACCESSIBILITY, AND INTERPRETATION.BENEFICIARIES  NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND GENERAL PUBLICSUBAWARDS  NONE

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P22AS00245TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES.AWARD SYNOPSIS: THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT, ONE STORY A THOUSAND VOICES, ARE TO CREATE A NEW PERMANENT EXHIBIT AT THE SHENANDOAH VALLEY CIVIL WAR MUSEUM, INCLUDE THE RENOVATION OF THE SECOND-FLOOR EXHIBIT SPACE AND THE CREATION OF ADDITIONAL EXHIBITS IN THE COURT ROOM ON THE FIRST FLOOR.  THE EXHIBIT WILL INCLUDE THE BACKGROUND OF THE WAR, BATTLE HISTORY, HUMAN INTEREST STORIES, AND VISITOR INFORMATION. THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON 20 CIVIL WAR BATTLEFIELDS IN THE SHENANDOAH VALLEY AND RELATED SITES AND STORIES.BENEFICIARIES: NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND GENERAL PUBLICSUBAWARDS: NONE

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P22AS00245TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES.AWARD SYNOPSIS: THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT, THE LONG ROAD TO FREEDOM, IS TO CREATE A SHENANDOAH VALLEY-WIDE TRAIL AND INITIATIVE TO TELL THE STORY OF AFRICAN AMERICANS IN THE SHENANDOAH VALLEY DURING THE CIVIL WAR ERA AND FROM THE CIVIL WAR TO CIVIL RIGHTS ERA.  THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON SITES RELATED TO THAT HISTORY, INCLUDING BATTLES BATTLEFIELD SUCH AS OPEQUON (THIRD WINCHESTER) (VA119). THE PROJECT WILL ENHANCE AND MODERNIZE BATTLEFIELD TECHNOLOGY ENHANCE THE ON-SITE EXPERIENCE AND PROVIDE ADDITIONAL INFORMATION, BACKGROUND, AND CONTEXT FOR VISITORS ON THE BATTLEFIELDS.  THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO INCLUDE EDUCATIONAL COMPONENTS FOR TEACHERS AND STUDENTS.BENEFICIARIES: NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND GENERAL PUBLICSUBAWARDS: NONE

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS00245TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE ABPP CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS, INCLUDING THE BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS  BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS  AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS.AWARD SYNOPSIS THIS GRANT IS FOR A TWO-YEAR PROJECT TO INVENTORY AND EVALUATE EXISTING INTERPRETATION AND CREATE A NEW COMPREHENSIVE INTERPRETATION PLAN FOR APPROXIMATELY 225 ACRES OF THE BATTLE OF BLADENSBURG IN PRINCE GEORGE S COUNTY, MARYLAND. ANACOSTIA TRAILS HERITAGE AREA, A 501C3 NON-PROFIT, WILL MANAGE A CONSULTANT TO COMPLETE THE PROJECT BASED ON USER FEEDBACK FROM DIVERSE GROUPS AND NEW TECHNOLOGIES NOT AVAILABLE DURING PREVIOUS INTERVENTIONS. THERE IS MORE INTEREST IN THE WAR OF 1812 IN MARYLAND SINCE THE BICENTENNIAL IN 2012, AND A LOT HAS HAPPENED SINCE THEN INCLUDING THE BLACK LIVES MATTER MOVEMENT, THE CAPITAL RIOTS, AND COVID-19. THE INTERPRETIVE INTERVENTIONS, NOW 10 YEARS OLD, NEED TO BE EVALUATED AND RETOOLED TO BE ACCURATE AND RELEVANT TO TODAY S DIVERSE AUDIENCES. DELIVERABLES WILL INCLUDE  AN INVENTORY OF EXISTING INTERPRETATION ELEMENTS GEOLOCATED ON A PUBLIC MAP, AN OVERVIEW OF CURRENT APPROACHES AND BEST PRACTICES FOR INTERPRETIVE SOLUTIONS IN HIGH-DENSITY URBAN AREAS INCLUDING NEW TECHNOLOGIES, A SURVEY AND ANALYSIS OF CONTEMPORARY HERITAGE AUDIENCES REGIONALLY AND NATIONALLY, AND A FINAL COMPREHENSIVE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THE INTERPRETATION OF WAR OF 1812 IN THE GREATER BLADENSBURG REGION.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS00245TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE ABPP CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS, INCLUDING THE BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS  BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS  AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS.AWARD SYNOPSIS THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT THE CREATION OF THE AMERICAN REVOLUTION EXPERIENCE TRAVELING EXHIBIT CENTERED ON  THROUGH-STORIES  REFLECTING DIVERSE INDIVIDUAL EXPERIENCES OF THE AMERICAN REVOLUTION THAT ENCOMPASS MULTIPLE BATTLEFIELDS. THE EXHIBITION S PERSON-CENTRIC APPROACH ALLOWS THE PROJECT TEAM TO EXPLORE THE CONFLICT THROUGH MULTIPLE LENSES AND GIVE VISITORS AN OPPORTUNITY TO DEVELOP A SENSE OF HISTORICAL EMPATHY FOR THE MEN AND WOMEN   PATRIOTS, LOYALISTS, ENSLAVED, FREE, FOREIGN NATIONALS, NATIVE AMERICANS, DESCENDANTS OF EARLY COLONISTS, RECENT IMMIGRANTS   WHOSE LIVES WERE UPENDED BY CONFLICT AND WHOSE ACTIONS HELPED SHAPE A NATION.THE TRAVELING EXHIBIT IS ENVISIONED AS A SERIES OF DIDACTIC SIGNS THAT ARE COMPLEMENTED BY TOUCH TECHNOLOGY AND REPLICA ARTIFACTS. THE TOUCH TECHNOLOGY WILL ENABLE VISITORS TO EXPLORE MUSEUM COLLECTIONS AND HISTORIC SITES THAT ARE RELATED TO THE FIGURES FEATURED IN THE EXHIBIT WHILE REPLICA ARTIFACTS SUCH AS CLOTHING, MAPS, DOCUMENTS, SOLDIER S RATIONS, RIFLERY, ETC., ADDS TO THE HUMANISTIC APPROACH TO THE EXHIBIT HELPING VISITORS IMAGINE THE EXPERIENCES OF THE EXHIBIT S PRIMARY SUBJECTS.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS00245TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE ABPP CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS, INCLUDING THE BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS  BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS  AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS.AWARD SYNOPSIS THIS 18 MONTH RESEARCH AND PLANNING PROJECT WILL ENSURE THAT THE LAKE CHAMPLAIN MARITIME MUSEUM IS CREATING A DIGITAL INTERACTIVE PORTAL THAT CENTERS THE USER EXPERIENCE, IS ACCESSIBLE FOR ALL, AND HIGHLIGHTS NEW RESEARCH USING DIGITAL TECHNOLOGIES. FUNDING WILL SUPPORT PLANNING FOR PLATFORM RESEARCH, USER TESTING, AND USER EVALUATION. IT WILL ALSO FUND SHARING PHOTOGRAMMETRIC MODELING OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR GUNBOAT SPITFIRE AND SELECT ASSOCIATED ARTIFACTS, AND PREPARATION FOR COLLECTIONS DIGITIZATION, INCLUDING CREATION OF COLLECTIONS ACCESS GUIDES, A COLLECTIONS DIGITIZATION PLAN, AND A DIGITIZATION STUDIO. THIS SCOPING GRANT WILL PREPARE LAKE CHAMPLAIN MARITIME MUSEUM TO DIGITIZE MUSEUM COLLECTIONS RELATED TO THE 250TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR, PLAN TO CREATE A DIGITAL PORTAL THAT WILL LAUNCH IN 2026, AND IDENTIFY TECHNOLOGY TO MEET THE NEEDS OF PUBLIC AUDIENCES AND CREATE NEW CONNECTIONS TO OUR SHARED HISTORY.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER  P22AS00245TO PROVIDE FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE ABPP CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS, INCLUDING THE BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION MODERNIZATION GRANTS  BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS  AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS.AWARD SYNOPSIS THIS 18-MONTH RESEARCH AND PLANNING PROJECT WILL ENSURE THAT THE LAKE CHAMPLAIN MARITIME MUSEUM IS CREATING A DIGITAL INTERACTIVE PORTAL THAT CENTERS THE USER EXPERIENCE, IS ACCESSIBLE FOR ALL, AND HIGHLIGHTS NEW RESEARCH USING DIGITAL TECHNOLOGIES. FUNDING WILL SUPPORT PLANNING FOR PLATFORM RESEARCH, USER TESTING, AND USER EVALUATION. IT WILL ALSO FUND SHARING PHOTOGRAMMETRIC MODELING OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR GUNBOAT SPITFIRE AND SELECT ASSOCIATED ARTIFACTS, AND PREPARATION FOR COLLECTIONS DIGITIZATION, INCLUDING CREATION OF COLLECTIONS ACCESS GUIDES, A COLLECTIONS DIGITIZATION PLAN, AND A DIGITIZATION STUDIO. THIS SCOPING GRANT WILL PREPARE LAKE CHAMPLAIN MARITIME MUSEUM TO DIGITIZE MUSEUM COLLECTIONS RELATED TO THE 250TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR, PLAN TO CREATE A DIGITAL PORTAL THAT WILL LAUNCH IN 2026, AND IDENTIFY TECHNOLOGY TO MEET THE NEEDS OF PUBLIC AUDIENCES AND CREATE NEW CONNECTIONS TO OUR SHARED HISTORY.

P22AS00131 (FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM: PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS): THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM (NPS ABPP) CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS (PPG). THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE COUNT OF OCEAN PROJECT, TITLED  AMERICAN REVOLUTION IN OCEAN COUNTY TRAIL, WILL ESTABLISH A DRIVING TRAIL THAT INTERPRETS THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR IN OCEAN COUNTY, NEW JERSEY, INCLUDING THE DESIGN, FABRICATION, AND INSTALLATION OF INTERPRETIVE WAYSIDES AT MULTIPLE ARMED CONFLICT SITES COMPRISING THE AFFAIR AT EGG HARBOR (1778), MANAHAWKIN SKIRMISH (1781, TOMS RIVER BLOCKHOUSE FIGHT (1782), LONG BEACH ISLAND MASSACRE (1782), AFFAIR AT CEDAR BRIDGE (1782), AND DEATH OF JOHN BACON AT ROSES TAVERN (1783)  PRODUCE 7 DOCUMENTARY VIDEOS FOR USE ON THE COUNTYS WEBSITE.

P22AS00131  FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS   THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  NPS ABPP  CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS  PPG   THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES  THE LITTLE BIG HORN COLLEGE PROJECT,  IT IS A GOOD DAY TO  RE LIVE LITTLE BIG MAN  THE MOVIE AND 50 YEARS OF CHANGING PERSPECTIVES ABOUT INDIAN WARS IN THE AMERICAN WEST,  WILL INCLUDE MULTI DAY SYMPOSIUM THAT INVESTIGATES THE MYTHS AND REALITIES OF MULTIPLE BATTLEFIELDS EXPLORED IN THE 1970 FILM LITTLE BIG MAN, INCLUDING THE BATTLE OF LITTLE BIG HORN  1878 , BATTLE OF ROSEBUD  1876 , AND THE WASHITA RIVER MASSACRE  1868   THE COLLEGE WILL ALSO CONDUCT ARCHIVAL RESEARCH AND ORAL HISTORY INTERVIEWS TO ENLARGE THE PUBLIC S UNDERSTANDING OF THESE SITES OF ARMED CONFLICT AND CREATE TEMPORARY EXHIBITS FOR USE DURING THE SYMPOSIUM

22AS00131 (FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM: PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS): THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM (NPS ABPP) CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS (PPG). THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE CAPITAL REGION LAND CONSERVANCY PROJECT, TITLED  INVESTIGATING THE CORE BATTLEFIELD OF NEW MARKET HEIGHTS,  WILL INVESTIGATE THE OVERLAPPING PORTION OF THE CIVIL WAR BATTLEFIELDS OF DEEP BOTTOM I (JULY, 1864), DEEP BOTTOM II (AUGUST, 1864), AND CHAFFINS FARM NEW MARKET HEIGHTS (SEPTEMBER, 1864) AT FOUR MILE CREEK FARM  CONDUCT THE INVESTIGATION USING A LIMITED ARCHEOLOGICAL SITE SURVEY, INCLUDING SHOVEL TESTS AND METAL DETECTION, AND USE THE RESULTS TO HELP PRODUCE A LAND MANAGEMENT PLAN.

P22AS00131  FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS   THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  NPS ABPP  CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS  PPG   THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES  THE CAMP DOUGLAS RESTORATION FOUNDATION PROJECT,   TRAVELING EXHIBIT S  FOR CAMP DOUGLAS,  WILL DESIGN AND FABRICATE MULTIPLE TRAVELING EXHIBITS THAT EXPLAIN CAMP DOUGLAS S ROLE AS A UNION TRAINING CENTER AND PRISONER OF WAR CAMP DURING THE AMERICAN CIVIL WAR

P22AS00131  FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS   THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  NPS ABPP  CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS  PPG   THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES  THE AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD TRUST PROJECT,  DOCUMENTING MULTICULTURAL RESOURCES ON VIRGINIA S BATTLEFIELDS,  WILL SELECT THREE CIVIL WAR BATTLEFIELDS IN VIRGINIA TO USE AS CASE STUDIES FOR A MULTICULTURAL RESOURCE ANALYSIS  THIS ANALYSIS WILL INCLUDE GUIDED ORAL HISTORY SESSIONS WITH TRIBAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICERS, PRIMARY SOURCE RESEARCH, EXISTING GIS GEO DATA, AND NON INVASIVE FIELD SURVEY TO PRODUCE A FINAL COMPREHENSIVE REPORT

P22AS00131  FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS   THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  NPS ABPP  CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS  PPG   THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES  THE HEART OF THE CIVIL WAR HERITAGE AREA PROJECT,  EXPANDING  CROSSROADS OF WAR  WEBSITE,  WILL UPDATE THE  CROSSROADS OF WAR  MARYLAND AND THE BORDER IN THE CIVIL WAR  WEBSITE TO INCLUDE NEW RESEARCH ABOUT AFRICAN AMERICAN EXPERIENCES DURING THE CIVIL WAR IN MARYLAND AND CONDUCT OUTREACH TO DRAW PUBLIC ATTENTION TO THE WEBSITE

P22AS00131 (FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM: PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS): THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM (NPS ABPP) CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS (PPG). THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. JUNIATA COLLEGE S PROJECT, TITLED FORT HALIFAX REDISCOVERY, WILL INVESTIGATE THE SEVEN YEARS WAR FORTIFICATION KNOWN AS FORT HALIFAX THROUGH ARCHEOLOGICAL FIELD SURVEYS, INCLUDING GROUND PENETRATING RADAR, LIDAR SCANS, AND SHOVEL TESTING  PRODUCE A TECHNICAL REPORT.

P22AS00131 (FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS)  THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM (NPS ABPP) CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS (PPG). THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW MEXICO PROJECT,  AMERICA S FIRST WAR  VAZQUEZ DE CORONADO AND THE RIO GRANDE PUEBLOS, 1540 1542,  WILL DESIGN, FABRICATE, AND INSTALL A MUSEUM QUALITY EXHIBIT THAT SHOWCASES ARTIFACT RECONSTRUCTIONS AND 3D ARCHITECTURAL RECONSTRUCTIONS OF THE PIEDRAS MARCADAS PUEBLO, A MAJOR BATTLEFIELD OF THE TIGUEX WAR OF OCTOBER 1540 TO MARCH 1541.

P22AS00131 (FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM: PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS): THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM (NPS ABPP) CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS (PPG). THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK PROJECT, TITLED  BATTLE OF FORT BULL: RESEARCH, INDIGENOUS VOICES, AND COMMUNITY STEWARDSHIP (PHASE II),  WILL INVESTIGATE FORT BULL, A BATTLEFIELD OF THE SEVEN YEARS WAR (MARCH 27, 1756) THROUGH ARCHEOLOGICAL SITE SURVEY, WITH THE INPUT OF THE ONEIDA INDIAN NATION ON HOW TO PORTRAY THEIR HISTORY TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC  PRODUCE A TECHNICAL REPORT.

P22AS00131  FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS   THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  NPS ABPP  CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS  PPG   THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES  THE BRADDOCK BATTLEFIELD HISTORY CENTER PROJECT,  DIVERSE VOICES TO PRESERVE THE BATTLEFIELD,  WILL ESTABLISH A GROUP OF DIVERSE STAKEHOLDERS TO PRODUCE AN INTERPRETIVE PLAN FOR THE SITE OF THE BATTLE OF THE MONONGAHELA  JULY 9, 1755   THE CENTER INTENDS FOR THIS GROUP TO INCLUDE FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBES, LOCAL MUSEUMS, UNIVERSITIES, AND OTHER NON PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO ENSURE MULTI CULTURAL PERSPECTIVES ARE INCLUDED IN THE INTERPRETATION OF THE BATTLEFIELD AND TO HELP BUILD AWARENESS WITH THE LOCAL COMMUNITY

P22AS00131  FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS   THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM  NPS ABPP  CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS  PPG   THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES  THE SAINT MARY S COLLEGE OF MARYLAND PROJECT,  MAPPING THE DRAGON  AN INDIGENOUS HISTORY OF BACON S REBELLION,  WILL DOCUMENT DRAGON SWAMP, A BATTLEFIELD OF BACON S REBELLION  1676 , THROUGH ARCHIVAL RESEARCH AND NON INVASIVE SITE SURVEY  THE RESULTS OF THIS SURVEY WILL BE USED TO BUILD A LANDSCAPE MODEL OF THE BATTLEFIELD IN GIS AND PRODUCE A FINAL COMPREHENSIVE REPORT  AS PART OF THIS PROJECT, THE COLLEGE WILL INVITE FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBES TO HELP INTERPRET THE SURVEY RESULTS AND INCLUDE ANY RECOMMENDATIONS FROM THE TRIBES IN THE FINAL REPORT

P22AS00131 (FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM: PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS): THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM (NPS ABPP) CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS (PPG). THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE LAKE CHAMPLAIN MARITIME MUSEUM AT BASIN HARBOR INC PROJECT, TITLED  SAVING SPITFIRE: PLANNING FOR THE FUTURE, WILL FORM AN ADVISORY COUNCIL OF THE DEPARTMENT OF THE NAVY, FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBES, SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS, AND MEMBERS OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY TO DEVELOP A RESEARCH DESIGN FOR THE FUTURE UNDERWATER INVESTIGATION OF THE REVOLUTIONARY WAR GUNBOAT SPITFIRE (1776) AND MAKE THE MUSEUMS EXISTING CATALOG OF ARTIFACTS RELATED TO THE GUNBOAT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC TO RESEARCH ONLINE.

P22AS00131 (FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM: PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS): THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM (NPS ABPP) CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS (PPG). THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN PROJECT, TITLED  RIVER RAISIN BATTLEFIELD ARCHEOLOGY PROJECT,  WILL INVESTIGATE A PORTION OF THE WAR OF 1812S RIVER RAISIN BATTLEFIELD THROUGH TWO ARCHEOLOGICAL FIELD SCHOOLS AND PRODUCE A TECHNICAL REPORT.

P22AS00131 (FY2022 AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM: PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS): THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE S AMERICAN BATTLEFIELD PROTECTION PROGRAM (NPS ABPP) CONSISTS OF FOUR GRANT PROGRAMS  BATTLEFIELD INTERPRETATION GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD LAND ACQUISITON GRANTS, BATTLEFIELD RESTORATION GRANTS, AND PRESERVATION PLANNING GRANTS (PPG). THE PPG PROGRAM PROVIDES FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STATE, LOCAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS, OTHER PUBLIC ENTITIES, EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, AND PRIVATE NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TO IDENTIFY, EVALUATE, INTERPRET, AND PROTECT HISTORIC BATTLEFIELDS AND SITES ASSOCIATED WITH ARMED CONFLICTS ON AMERICAN SOIL THROUGH NON-ACQUISITION PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES. THE TOWN OF MONTAGUE PROJECT, TITLED  1676 BATTLE OF GREAT FALLS (WISSATINNEWAG-PESKEOMPSKUT): SITE IDENTIFICATION AND EVALUATION PHASE III  EDUCATION,  WILL CONDUCT A THIRD PHASE OF ARCHEOLOGICAL INVESTIGATIONS ON THE 1676 BATTLE OF GREAT FALLS SITE, A BATTLEFIELD OF KINGS PHILIPS WAR (1675-1676), AND DEVELOP DESIGNS FOR FUTURE INTERPRETIVE WAYSIDES.
